name: df-prmo
body: |- wceq(cprmo, cmpt(s0, cn0, cprod(s1, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)), cif(cv(s1), nat1, wcel(cv(s1), cprime)))))
comment: Define the primorial function on nonnegative integers as the product of all prime numbers less than or equal to the integer. For example, ` ( #p `` 1 0 ) = 2 x. 3 x. 5 x. 7 = 2 1 0 ` (see ~ ex-prmo ). In the literature, the primorial function is written as a postscript hash: 6# = 30. In contrast to ~ prmorcht , where the primorial function is defined by using the sequence builder ( ` P = seq 1 ( x. , F ) ` ), the more specialized definition of a product of a series is used here. (Contributed by AV, 28-Aug-2020.)
